intro: Solanum morella var. schultesii, commonly known as the Schultesi's nightshade, is a variant of the nightshade genus native to certain regions of South America. It is a shrub-like plant characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves that are typically oval to elliptic in shape. The flowers are small, usually white or pale green, and appear in clusters, followed by berries that mature to a deep purple or black color. This plant is part of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known species such as tomatoes and potatoes. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and has some historical use in traditional medicine.
